𐀿 zo 𐘎 ZO ZU 𔖪 za 𔖩 zi 𐀼 za 𐚙 Zenit 𐘠 TI 𐠯 ti 𐀵 to 𐘄 TO top 𐘹 TU 𐠮 te 𐠮 de down

𐘄 TO 𐀵 toʳ > •thro στό

𐀵 toʳ r component firmly supported by throne, thorax, trapez, τάρπη

𐀵-𐀜 to-no throne ⇔ θρόνος •chair (Odyssey I 145+)
𐀵-𐀫-𐀜-𐀺-𐀒 to-ro-no-wo-ko •chair-maker(s) worker
𐀵-𐀜-𐀁-𐀐-𐀳-𐀪-𐀃 to-no-e-ke-te-ri-o religious feast

𐀵 𐀟 𐀼 to-pe-za τoρπέζα table 𐀵-𐀟-𐀼 to-pe-za τράπεζα (Doric: τράπεσδα) 'table' ⇔ τράπεζα trapez torpeza torpedza trapesda
to-pe-za ra-e-ja 'stone table' 𓊵 𓏏 𓊪 𓊯 𓊰 𓊲 𓊩
to-pe-za ku-te-se-ja 'ebony table'
to-pe-za e-re-pa-te-ja 'ivory table'

𐀵-𐀜 to-no-qe θόρνος (>θρόνος) throne , chair 𐀵 𐀜 𐀤 to-no-qe

𐀵-𐀨-𐀐 to-ra-ke thorax

𐀵-𐀞 to-pa τάρπη basket … tarp > korb ?

"𐀵-𐀫-𐀊","to-ro-ja","trojan woman" •trroja
"𐀵-𐀫","to-ro","•anthroponym ⇔ Τρώς (Iliad V.265+) •genitive of to-ro "

𐀵-𐀔-𐀒 to-ma-ko √Taur? name of an ox
𐀵-𐀄-𐀏 to-u-ka Tuch < Turk?

𐀵-𐀒 to-ko “tragen” 𓅱 𓏏 𓍿 beget child

𐀵-𐀵 to-to that 𒌓 this, •'this (year)' •der Turn

𐀵-𐀕 to-me τόμε (>τόνε) dem him (see also ‘toe’)

𐀵𐀔𐀒 to-ma-ko Στόμαργος
